messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.



#
# Fatal error in ../../src/ast/scopes.cc, line 2691
# Check failed: NeedsContext().
#
#
#
#FailureMessage Object: 0x772b361ea460
==== C stack trace ===============================

    out/debug_asan/d8(void v8::internal::DeclarationScope::AllocateScopeInfos<v8::internal::Isolate>(v8::internal::ParseInfo*, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Script>, v8::internal::Isolate*)+0x9b0) [0x59009ebdfe70]

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 2648 to line 2687 in src/ast/scopes.cc:
2648|     scope->AllocateNonParameterLocalsAndDeclaredGlobals();
2649| 
2650|     // Force allocation of a context for this scope if necessary. For a 'with'
2651|     // scope and for a function scope that makes an 'eval' call we need a
2652|     // context, even if no local variables were statically allocated in the
2653|     // scope. Likewise for modules and function scopes representing asm.js
2654|     // modules. Also force a context, if the scope is stricter than the outer
2655|     // scope.
2656|     bool must_have_context =
2657|         scope->is_with_scope() || scope->is_module_scope() ||
2658| #if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2659|         scope->IsAsmModule() ||
2660| #endif  // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2661|         scope->ForceContextForLanguageMode() ||
2662|         (scope->is_function_scope() &&
2663|          scope->AsDeclarationScope()->sloppy_eval_can_extend_vars()) ||
2664|         (scope->is_block_scope() && scope->is_declaration_scope() &&
2665|          scope->AsDeclarationScope()->sloppy_eval_can_extend_vars());
2666| 
2667|     // If we didn't allocate any locals in the local context, then we only
2668|     // need the minimal number of slots if we must have a context.
2669|     if (scope->num_heap_slots_ == scope->ContextHeaderLength() &&
2670|         !must_have_context) {
2671|       scope->num_heap_slots_ = 0;
2672|     }
2673| 
2674|     // Allocation done.
2675|     DCHECK(scope->num_heap_slots_ == 0 ||
2676|            scope->num_heap_slots_ >= scope->ContextHeaderLength());
2677|     return Iteration::kDescend;
2678|   });
2679| }
2680| 
2681| template <typename IsolateT>
2682| void Scope::AllocateScopeInfosRecursively(
2683|     IsolateT* isolate, MaybeHandle<ScopeInfo> outer_scope,
2684|     std::unordered_map<int, Handle<ScopeInfo>>& scope_infos_to_reuse) {
2685|   DCHECK(scope_info_.is_null());
2686|   MaybeHandle<ScopeInfo> next_outer_scope = outer_scope;
2687|
